description: Number of residue classes modulo n-th primorial number which contain a prime.
example: a(3) = 11 since 30 is the 3rd primorial number and 30k+m can be prime if m = 2, 3 or 5 (once each with k = 0) or m = 1, 7, 11, 13, 17, 19, 23 or 29 (each for an infinite number of values of k)
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Sep 08 2000
